comment: Dr. Bright is one of the best professors at Kennesaw. I wish she taught every class!!!!! She was so always so caring and really understands that students have a lot going on outside of school. There may be a few assignments and quizzes due a week but it is super easy and quick. If you have to take Psych, you need to take her!
I wish Dr. B taught every class! She really cares for her students and wants us to succeed. Dr. Bright is probably the best teacher I have had at kennesaw

Dr. Bright is by far the sweetest and most caring prof at KSU. She is very flexible with due dates and actually understands that we have busy schedules. She sometimes sends us videos on instructions for assignments and always makes sure to take a few minutes to encourage us. Dr. Bright really cares for her students, and it shows. take her!

Please take Dr. B! She is super understanding and compassionate, she's pushed back due dates for assignments for almost up to a month and would send very sweet and supportive emails too! I think that as long as she can see you're trying and participating, she'll work with you and whatever situation you might be in. TAKE NOTES everything is openbook

TAKE HER!!!!!!!!! If you have any problems completing an assignment, she will give you extra time. Gives us a whole week to complete exams (you can use your notes) and the whole class is done through achieve (very easy website to navigate through.) She is very sweet and really believes in her students

Dr. Bright is the best professor I've ever had. This class is challenging, but she genuinely cares about her students.If you have issues with technology or miss an assignment due to personal issues, she is willing to work with you to ensure you can perform the best you can. I cannot give enough positive feedback. Wish she taught every course.

This class includes weekly reading from the textbook but all tests and quizzes are open note, so if you take good notes you are set. She also gives extra credit points if the average is too low and works with you if you need an extension. She understands we have lives outside of this class and works hard to make sure we have the things we need.

Took the online course, very straight forward and easy. All assignments on the syllabus so make sure to check all the time. All tests are open note. Small quizzes (easy) and short and sweet assignments for each chapter. Very willing to work with you if you need flexibility, answers emails quickly. Taking another class with her next semester.

Professor bright is a very nice professor, however, instructions for assignments aren't the clearest or themost organized; tests are given like every other week and doesn't give you enough time to study content; gives study guides a few days before exams, so not the best preparation. not many assignmnets, so tests are an important factor to passing
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Dr Bright can be a little disorganized but i just think that might be because shes new to online classes or something. Shes a great professor and shes super understanding. We had about 3-4 tests and a couple of quizzes that were open book. Youll only fail her class if you actively try to. Passes with a 93 and Im taking her again for PSYC2013.
Her class can be a little disorganized, but shes super nice. The test are lockdown browser, but they are open notes. She also extends due dates if necessary.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: She is caring, understanding, gives you plenty of time to turn in assignments, and has some pretty funny stories that relate back to human development. She gave us 3 attempts for every quiz and let us use handwritten notes on exams. The textbook will be your best friend, make sure to read and take notes. She posted a video lecture maybe twice.

Dr. Bright is by fa my favorite professor I've had at KSU. The class is broken up into one or two chapters to read in your textbook per week, a quiz in which you get 3 attempts on, and a discussion every other week. She is also extremely understanding if you need extra time on an assignment. I would take her again in a heartbeat.

i definitely wouldnt recommend taking this class if you like an organized class. it was pretty frustrating the way she set the class up, but its a pretty easy class if you do your work. this class is not as hard as people are making it seem, its a standard intro class

This class is just teaching yourself from the textbook. Her tests were somewhat hard but eventually, she started giving us a notecard to help us and the study guides became WAY more reflective of the tests as time went by. I probably wouldn't take her again even tho I got an A. She was very flaky because she was "new to KSU".

I do not recommend taking her. Never graded any assignment, claimed to be online 24 hours a day yet never replied to emails or graded anything. Refused to follow the syllabus as well. Ended up with way less grades at the end, bringing the overall grade down. Also made horrible notes to study from and never enough info for test. DO NOT TAKE!!!!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Absolutely horrible professor do not take. She will not answer your emails and will not grade anything right up until the end of semester. Makes it very hard to pass
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Worst Professor at KSU. She does not grade anything on time, doesn't follow her own syllabus and gives out ridiculous tests that don't come near to what she taught. She gave out ALL grades a day before semester ends. She does not teach and demands ridiculous criteria. Also didn't provide enough grades that she listed on her own syllabus.

Do not take this class. Professor Bright assigned her syllabus, made us buy an overpriced textbook, provided unhelpful powerpoints/study guides and made the tests obnoxiously hard. I am a straight A student and she made it almost impossible to follow along or even study for her exams. She was very communicative but made no effort to help us pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Worst class I've take at KSU. Professor updated D2L maybe once a month. Only 4 tests, almost no communication about the material. Class had minimal online interaction except 3 or 4 discussion posts. Literally the entire class you read the textbook and teach yourself. Would not take again, nor would I recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: At the beginning, she gave us no lecture content. 0. Just read the whole textbook and take a test. Her 1st study guide was so unhelpful. She eventually started posting lectures, but they were pretty general & didn't give too useful notes information. Her study guides improved with time. She NEVER followed the syllabus. Grades very late. Skip her
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things
